headline.main: World Briefing | Middle East: Israel: Arab Lawmaker Charged

lead_paragraph: Azmi Bishara, an Israeli Arab member of Parliament, was formally charged with voicing support for the Lebanese guerrilla group Hezbollah, becoming the first Israeli lawmaker to be indicted for remarks made in office. The indictment charges him with encouraging violence and expressing support for a terrorist organization. The offense carries a maximum penalty of three years in jail. Mr. Bishara faces separate charges for organizing visits by Israeli Arabs to Syria, with which Israel is technically at war. Joel Greenberg (NYT)
abstract: Azmi Bishara, Israeli Arab member of Parliament, is formally charged with voicing support for guerrilla group Hezbollah; indictment charges him with encouraging violence and expressing support for terrorist organization; he faces separate charges for organizing visits by Israeli Arabs to Syria, with which Israel is technically at war (S)
